item.title: SOLID - Single Responsibility Principle (SRP)
item.description: SRP states that a class should have only one reason to change or only one responsibility. In other words, a class should have a single, well-defined purpose. Let’s understand this concept with a quick example. Suppose we have a User class and also there are two functioanlities accociated with this class i.e. saveToDatabase and sendWelcomeEmail.
